name: Cream Cheese Frosting without Powdered Sugar
author: Anne Brothers & Rick Smetzer
summary: This is an alternative to the classic recipe that calls for powdered sugar. We use it to frost cocktail cake. Try it on applesauce, spice, banana, or carrot cakes too.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted and cooled
directions: Blend together cream cheese, butter, brown sugar, vanilla, and almond extract with an electric mixer until starting to become stiff
Beat together until mixture is whipped, making sure not to overmix as it will collapse
Use immediately or store in a sealed container in the refrigerator until use
